author: Anonymous Mouse
title: Q and A for atomic non-distinct
question:
Hello,
In the data driven templates, when there is an atomic non-distinct type of data, let's say String, then the cond question would be (string? x) and the answer would be (... x). I am wondering when designing the function if the answer must be an expression that involves the parameter x or if it is ok to just put a value like 2 as the answer instead. Thank you!
student_answer:
I'm pretty sure it's fine to have just a value rather than an expression involving the parameter x.
For example, if I have:
(@htdd Data1)
;; Data1 is one of:
;; -12
;; -String
;; -13
;; -14
and I had a function that produced true if Data1 was 13, then writing:
(cond [Q A]
      [(string? d1) false]
      [Q A]
      [Q A])
would make sense.
